CONJUGATES: suntans (n. pl.) | suntans (v. 3rd sg.) | suntanning (v. pr. p.) | suntanned (v. pt./pp.)
ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'sun' (from Old English sunne) and 'tan' (from Old English tannian, referring to browning leather). The compound specifically referring to skin coloration became popular in the early 20th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun (denotes a person, place, thing, or idea)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A brown coloring of the skin resulting from exposure to ultraviolet radiation, usually from the sun or a sunlamp.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 皮肤因暴露于紫外线（通常来自阳光或晒黑灯）而呈现的棕色。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She came back from her holiday with a glorious suntan.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她度假回来时晒出了一身漂亮的棕褐色。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Verb, used transitively (requiring a direct object) or intransitively (not requiring a direct object)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To acquire a suntan; to cause the skin to become brown from exposure to the sun.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We spent the whole afternoon suntanning on the beach.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在海滩上晒了一下午太阳。
